sentences.english: My first love, I and you have mutual affinity.
sentences.chinese: 我的初恋，我与你心心相印。

sentences.english: Honey, we always know each other?s mind.
sentences.chinese: 我的爱人，我们一直是心心相印的。

sentences.english: The hearts of our people accord with those of yours.
sentences.chinese: 我们两国人民心心相印。

sentences.english: Red and white together signify unity.
Susan and I are convinced that we are true soul mates.
sentences.chinese: 苏珊和我都确信我们是真正的心心相印。

sentences.english: Third, keep closer humanities exchanges and remain good brothers of mutual affinity.
sentences.chinese: 密切人文交流，做心心相印的好兄弟。

definition: kindred spirits
hearts linked as one, just as the proverbial rhinoceros communicates emotion telepathically through his single horn (idiom); fig. two hearts beat as one

definition: love is more solid than gold (idiom)
enduring while the world lasts (idiom)/eternal
to have an affinity with each other (idiom)/to find each other congenial
to moisten with spittle (idiom); sharing meager resources/mutual help in humble circumstances
in perfect harmony/in sync/lit. qin and se sing in harmony
to be kind and love one another (idiom); bound by deep emotions
lit. to lift the tray to eyebrow level (idiom); mutual respect in a marriage
(to live together until the) white hairs of old age (idiom); to live to a ripe old age in conjugal bliss/until death do us part
lit. a pair of birds flying close together (idiom)/fig. two hearts beating as one/name of a sweet and sour chicken wing dish
each other/one another
close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
from dawn to dusk/all the time
